turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Yeah

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Two legs, nice rack...

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Yeah, whatever.  I want you to go out with her.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Sure, Sparky.  I'll get right on it.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You just said

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You need money to take a girl out

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: But you'd go out with her if you had the cake?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You got it, Verona.  I pick up the tab, you do the honors.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You're gonna pay me to take out some girl?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I can't date her sister until that one gets a boyfriend.  And that's the catch. She doesn't want a boyfriend.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I can't take a girl like that out on twenty bucks.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Fine, thirty.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Take it or leave it.  This isn't a negotiation.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Fifty, and you've got your man.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: When I shell out fifty, I expect results.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I'm on it

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Watching the bitch trash my car doesn't count as a date.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I got her under control. She just acts crazed in public to keep up the image.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I just upped my price

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: A hundred bucks a date.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Forget her sister, then.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: It's about time.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: A deal's a deal.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: How'd you do it?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Get her to act like a human

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I don't know, Dorsey. ..the limo.-the flowers.  Another hundred for the tux --

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Enough with the Barbie n' Ken shit. I know.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Are you lost?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Nope - just came by to chat

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: We don't chat.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Well, actually, I thought I'd run an idea by you.  You know, just to see if you're interested.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: We're not.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: But she can't go out with you because her sister is this insane head case and no one will go out with her. right?

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Does this conversation have a purpose?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: So what you need to do is recruit a guy who'll go out with her.  Someone who's up for the job.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: I hear you're helpin' Verona.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Uh,  yeah.  We're old friend*

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You and Verona?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What?  We took bathes together when we were kids.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: You better not fuck this up.  I'm heavily invested.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey -- it's all for the higher good right?

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Patrick Verona   Random skid.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: That's Pat Verona? The one who was gone for a year? I heard he was doing porn movies.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I'm sure he's completely incapable of doing anything that interesting.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: He always look so

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Block E?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Mandella, eat.  Starving yourself is a very slow way to die.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Just a little.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: An attempted slit.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I realize that the men of this fine institution are severely lacking, but killing yourself so you can be with William Shakespeare is beyond the scope of normal teenage obsessions.  You're venturing far past daytime talk show fodder and entering the world of those who need very expensive therapy.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: But imagine the things he'd say during sex.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: The people at this school are so incredibly foul.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: You could always go with me.  I'm sure William has some friends.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: So he has this huge raging fit about Sarah Lawrence and insists that I go to his male-dominated, puking frat boy, number one golf team school. I have no say at all.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: William would never have gone to a state school.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: William didn't even go to high school

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: That's never been proven

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Neither has his heterosexuality.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I appreciate your efforts toward a speedy death, but I'm consuming.  Do you mind?

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Does it matter?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: If I was Bianca, it would be, "Any school you want, precious.  Don't forget your tiara."

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: You think this'll work?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: No fear.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: What'd he say?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Who cares?

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: You went to the party?  I thought we were officially opposed to suburban social activity.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I didn't have a choice.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: You didn't have a choice?  Where's Kat and what have you done with her?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I did Bianca a favor and it backfired.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: You didn't

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I got drunk.  I puked.  I got rejected. It was big fun.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Can you even imagine?  Who the hell would go to this a bastion of commercial excess?

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Well, I guess we're not, since we don't have dates .

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Listen to you!  You sound like Betty, all pissed off because Archie is taking Veronica.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Okay, okay, we won't go.  It's not like I have a dress anyway

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You ' re looking at this from the wrong perspective.  We're making a statement.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Oh, good.  Something new and different for us.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Have you seen him?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: William - he asked me to meet him here.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Oh, honey -- tell me we haven't' progressed to full-on hallucinations.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I mean Wo-man.  How ya doin'?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Sweating like a pig, actually.  And yourself?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: There's a way to get a guy's attention.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: My mission in life.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Pick you up Friday, then

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Oh, right.  Friday.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: The night I take you to places you've never been before.  And back.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Like where?  The 7-Eleven on Burnside? Do you even know my name, screwboy?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I know a lot more than that

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You hate me don't you?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I don't really think you warrant that strong an emotion.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Then say you'll spend Dollar Night at the track with me.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: And why would I do that?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Come on -- the ponies, the flat beer, you with money in your eyes, me with my hand on your ass...

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You -- covered in my vomit.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Seven-thirty?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Are you following me?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I was in the laundromat. I saw your car. Thought I'd say hi.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Hi

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You're not a big talker, are you?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Depends on the topic. My fenders don't really whip me into a verbal frenzy.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: hey.  Great show, huh?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: That's what you want, isn't it?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Do you mind?  You're sort of ruining it for me.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You know, these guys are no Bikini Kill or The Raincoats, but they're right up there.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You know who The Raincoats are?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Why, don't you?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: "I'm getting trashed, man." Isn't that what you're supposed to do at a party?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I say, do what you wanna do.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Funny, you're the only one

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I'm fine. I'm

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You're not okay.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I just need to lie down for awhile

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Uh, uh. You lie down and you'll go to sleep

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I know, just let me sleep

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: What if you have a concussion? My dog went to sleep with a concussion and woke up a vegetable. Not that I could tell the difference...

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: This is so patronizing.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Leave it to you to use big words when you're shitfaced.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Why 're you doing this?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I told you

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You don't care if I die

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Sure, I do

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Because then I'd have to start taking out girls who like me.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Like you could find one

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: See that?  Who needs affection when I've got blind hatred?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Just let me sit down.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Why'd you let him get to you?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Dorsey.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I hate him.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I know.  It'd have to be a pretty big deal to get you to mainline tequila. You don't seem like the type.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Hey man. . .  You don ' t think I can be "cool"?  You don't think I can be "laid back" like everyone else?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I thought you were above all that

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You know what they say

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Kat! Wake up!

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: And I'm in control of it.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: But it's Gigglepuss - I know you like them.  I saw you there.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: When you were gone last year -- where were you?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Busy

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Were you in jail?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: No, you weren't

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Then why'd you ask?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Why'd you lie?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I should do this.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: This.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Start a band?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: My father wouldn't approve of that that

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You don't strike me as the type that would ask permission.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Oh, so now you think you know me?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I'm gettin' there

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: So what ' s up with your dad?  He a pain in the ass?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: He just wants me to be someone I'm not.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: BIANCA

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: No offense, but you're sister is without.  I know everyone likes her and all, but ...

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Excuse me, have you seen The Feminine Mystique?  I lost my copy.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I heard there was a poetry reading.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You 're so --

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Pleasant?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Wholesome.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Unwelcome.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Unwelcome?  I guess someone still has her panties in a twist.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Don't for one minute think that you had any effect whatsoever on my panties.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: So what did I have an effect on ?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Other than my upchuck reflex? Nothing.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: He left!  I sprung the dickhead and he cruised on me.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Look up, sunshine

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I guess I never told you I'm afraid of heights.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: C'mon.  It's not that bad

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Try lookin' at it from this angle

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Put your right foot there --

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Forget it.  I'm stayin'.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You want me to climb up and show you how to get down?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: The Partridge Family?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I figured it had to be something ridiculous to win your respect.  And piss you off.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Good call.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: So how'd you get Chapin to look the other way?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I dazzled him with my wit

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: A soft side? Who knew?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Yeah, well, don't let it get out

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: So what's your excuse?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Acting the way we do.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Yes

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I don't like to do what people expect. Then they expect it all the time and they get disappointed when you change.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: So if you disappoint them from the start, you're covered?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Something like that

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Then you screwed up

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You never disappointed me.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You up for it?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: For. . . ?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: State trooper?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Fallacy.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: The duck?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Hearsay.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I know the porn career's a lie.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Tell me something true.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I hate peas.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: No -- something real.  Something no one else knows.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You're sweet.  And sexy.  And completely hot for me.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: No one else knows

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You're amazingly self-assured. Has anyone ever told you that?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Go to the prom with me

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Is that a request or a command?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You know what I mean

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: No what?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: No, I won't go with you

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Because I don't want to. It's a stupid tradition.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Create a little drama?  Start a new rumor?  What?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: So I have to have a motive to be with you?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You tell me.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You need therapy.  Has anyone ever told you that?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Answer the question, Patrick

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Nothing!  There's nothing in it for me. Just the pleasure of your company.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: How'd you get a tux at the last minute?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: It's Scurvy's.  His date got convicted. Where'd you get the dress?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: It's just something I had.  You know

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Oh huh

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Look, I'm  -- sorry -- that I questioned your motives.  I was wrong.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: My grandmother's .

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: That's where I was last year.  She'd never lived alone -- my grandfather died -- I stayed with her.  I wasn't in jail, I don't know Marilyn Manson, and I've never slept with a Spice Girl.  I spent a year sitting next to my grandma on the couch watching Wheel of Fortune.  End of story.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: That ' s completely adorable!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: It gets worse -- you still have your freshman yearbook?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Wait I...

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You were paid to take me out!  By -- the one person I truly hate.  I knew it was a set-up!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: It wasn't like that.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Really?  What was it like?  A down payment now, then a bonus for sleeping with me?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I didn't care about the money.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: A Fender Strat. You bought this?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I thought you could use it. When you start your band.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Besides, I had some extra cash. Some asshole paid me to take out a really great girl.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Is that right?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Yeah, but then I fucked up. I fell for her.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Why is my veggie burger the only burnt object on this grill?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Because I like to torture you.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Oh, Bianca?  Can you get me my freshman yearbook?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Don ' t you even dare. . .

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I thought we decided you were going to school here.  At U of 0.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: You decided.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: This from someone whose diary is devoted to favorite grooming tips?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Enough!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: My insurance does not cover PMS

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Then tell them I had a seizure.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Is this about Sarah Lawrence? You punishing me?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I thought you were punishing me.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Why can't we agree on this?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Because you're making decisions for me.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: As a parent, that's my right

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: So what I want doesn't matter?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You're eighteen.  You don't know what you want.  You won't know until you're forty-five and you don't have it.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I want to go to an East Coast school! I want you to trust me to make my own choices.  I want --

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Was that your sister?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Yeah.  She left with some bikers Big ones.  Full of sperm.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Funny.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I don't understand the allure of dehydrated food.  Is this something I should be hip to?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: No, Daddy.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: So tell me about this dance. Was it fun?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Parts of it.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Which parts?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: The part where Bianca beat the hell out of some guy.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Bianca did what?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: What's the matter?  Upset that I rubbed off on her?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: No -- impressed.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You know, fathers don't like to admit that their daughters are capable of running their own lives.  It means we've become spectators.  Bianca still lets me play a few innings.  You've had me on the bleachers for years.  When you go to Sarah Lawrence, I won't even be able to watch the game.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: When I go?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Oh, Christ.  Don't tell me you've changed your mind.  I already sent 'em a check.

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: Katarina Stratford.  My, my.  You've been terrorizing Ms. Blaise again.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Expressing my opinion is not a terrorist action.

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: Well, yes, compared to your other choices of expression this year, today's events are quite mild.  By the way, Bobby Rictor's gonad retrieval operation went quite well, in case you're interested.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I still maintain that he kicked himself in the balls.  I was merely a spectator.

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: The point is Kat -- people perceive you as somewhat ...

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Tempestuous?

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: No ... I believe "heinous bitch" is the term used most often.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Am I supposed to feel better? Like, right now?  Or do I have some time to think about it?

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: Just smack her now.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey there.  Tired of breathing?

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Cool pictures.  You a fan?

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Yeah.  I guess.

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Macbeth, right?

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Kat a fan, too?

turns.speaker: MANDELLA
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Say it

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Whatever the hell it is you're standin' there waitin' to say.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: What plan?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The situation is, my man Cameron here has a major jones for Bianca Stratford.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: What is it with this chick?  She have three tits?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I think I speak correctly when I say that Cameron's love is pure.  Purer than say -- Joey Dorsey's.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Dorsey can plow whoever he wants. I'm just in this for the cash.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That's where we can help you.  With Kat.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: So Dorsey can get the girl?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Patrick, Pat, you're not looking at the big picture.  Joey's just a pawn. We set this whole thing up so Cameron can get the girl.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You two are gonna help me tame the wild beast?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: We're your guys.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Good enough.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Are you telling me I'm a -  "non-smoker"?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Just for now.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Ever been to Club Skunk?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I prefer to think of it simply as an alternative to what the law allows.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I'm likin' you guys better

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: So you got cozy with she who stings?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: No - I've got a sweet-payin' job that I'm about to lose.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: You were right. She's still pissed.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Sweet love, renew thy force!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Man -- don't say shit like that to  me. People can hear you.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I missed you.

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: It says here you exposed yourself to a group of freshmen girls.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: It was a bratwurst.  I was eating lunch.

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: With the teeth of your zipper?

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: I don't understand, Patrick.  You haven't done anything asinine this week. Are you not feeling well?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Touch of the flu.

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: I'm at a loss, then.  What should we talk about? Your year of absence?

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: Why don't we discuss your driving need to be a hemorrhoid?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: What's to discuss?

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: You weren't abused, you aren't stupid, and as far as I can tell, you're only slightly psychotic -- so why is it that you're such a fuck-up?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Well, you know -- there's the prestige of the job title... and the benefits package is pretty good...

turns.speaker: MISS PERKY
turns.text: You're completely demented.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: See you next week!

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: In the microwave.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Make anyone cry today?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: What's a synonym for throbbing?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Sarah Lawrence is on the other side of the country.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Jesus!  Can a man even grab a sandwich before you women start dilating?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Tumescent!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: You're not helping.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Would you rather be ravished by a pirate or a British rear admiral?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Pirate -- no question.

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: They'll dance, they'll kiss, they'll come home.  Let her go.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Kissing?  Is that what you think happens?  Kissing isn't what keeps me up to my elbows in placenta all day.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: What do you wanna watch?  We've got crap, crap, crap or crap

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Dr. Ruth?

turns.speaker: SHARON
turns.text: Have a great time, honey!

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: But -- who -- what --?
